result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly L. Paulson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $4,600.00. (Payment made 10/21/2015 in the amount of $2,000.00 (cashiers check provided to DA) so remaining balance would be $2,600.00).  
Pay restitution in full prior to the termination of probation.

Pay costs.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Kim Birch or her establishment, Allure Hair Design.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Write a letter of apology to Kim Birch if requested by the victim and to be provided to her agent for review. 
Early discharge from probation if recommended by the agent.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Holly L. Paulson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:56 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen provides an Amended Information (amended to misdemeanor)
Victim notification had been completed and victim is in Court today.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - No contest 
Count 4 - No contest 
Count 5 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on all 5 misdemeanor counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Court reviews the victim impact statement provided by the State.
Atty Knaapen indicates the victim in court but does not wish to make a statement.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months 
Pay restitution of $4,600.00 (payment made 10/21/15 in amount of $2,000.00 (cashiers check provided to DA) so remaining balance would be $2,600.00) Pay restitution in full prior to the termination of probation.
Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Kim Burch or her establishment, Allure Hair Design
Write a letter of apology to Kim Burch if requested by the victim and to be provided to agent for review.
Pay costs
Early discharge from probation if recommended by the Agent.  

Count 2 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months
Comply with conditions in Count 1 
Pay costs

Count 3 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months
Comply with conditions in Count 1 
Pay costs

Count 4 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months
Comply with conditions in Count 1 
Pay costs 

Count 5 -
Withheld sentence
Placed on Probation for 36 months 
Comply with conditions in Count 1 
Pay costs

Defendant Holly L. Paulson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Holly L. Paulson in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Holly L. Paulson in court. 

Clerk swears in Ms. Paulson. 
Court questions the defendant regarding her Petition for Appointment of Counsel. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds the defendant is partially indigent. 
Repay at $50 every 2 weeks.  

Atty Eric Sheets is present and accepts the appointment. 
Court advises parties of the Adjourned Initial Appearance date.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No contact direct/indirect with Kim Kucksdorf or Allure Hair Design.

Defendant Holly L. Paulson in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant notes she has a hearing on 3/27 for a court appointed attorney. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue to 4/6 at 1:30 to allow for the appointment of counsel. 

Atty Knaapen recommends a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant questions if she is allowed to leave the state  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on March 27, 2015 at 11:45 am.
